citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of a novel facultatively alkaliphilic Nitrobacter species, N. alkalicus sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Nitrobacter alkalicus sp. nov.
Pear-shaped cells (0.6–0.9x1.2–1.8 μm) multiply by budding.
Motile cells possess single polar or subpolar flagellum.
All cells contain several layers of intracytoplasmic membranes located parallel to the cell membrane.
Cell wall contains additional external layer with a regular subunit arrangement.
Lithoautotrophic growth with nitrite occurs at a broad pH range from 6.5 to 10.2, with an optimum at 9.5.
Potential for heterotrophic growth was not detected within 4 weeks of incubation.
Growth at a low pH is possible only under nitrite limitation.
The G+C content of the DNA is 62 ± 0.5 mol%.
The sequence of the nearly complete 16S rRNA gene of strains AN1, AN2, and AN4 is deposited in the Genbank database under accession no. AF069956-AF069958.
Strains were isolated from the sediments of soda lakes and from soda soil.

Type strain: Nitrobacter alkalicus AN1 is deposited with the bacterial culture collection of the Department of Microbiology, Delft University of Technology, Delft, The Netherlands under the number LMD 97.163.
